abstracts.cdata!:
The project would assist the Federal and
            six Northern State Governments: (a) to expand and diversify
            secondary education; (b) to increase the supply of primary
            school teachers; and (c) to support an applied research
            effort aimed at the development of primary education better
            related to the economic and social needs of the Northern
            States. The project, in association with complementary works
            to be undertaken by the Northern States, would comprise
            construction, furniture and equipment for: (a) about 30,000
            places in 19 new and 40 existing secondary schools; (b)
            about 5,000 places in 8 new and 16 existing primary teacher
            training colleges and about 100 places in 1 secondary
            teacher training college; and (c) about 1,000 places at the
            Department of Basic Studies and Faculty of Education at
            Ahmadu Bello University, together with technical assistance
            for a primary education research project at the Institute of Education.
